description: This function generates a visualization of two parallel lines cut by a transversal line. It is designed to help students understand the concepts of parallel lines, transversal lines, and the angles formed by them, which are fundamental concepts in geometry.

educational_standards.description: Identify parts of two parallel lines cut by a transversal including vertical angle, alternate interior angles, alternate exterior angles.
Solve problems involving relationships between the angles created by parallel lines cut by a transversal.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Parallel Lines Cut by Transversal
stimulus_type_specification.description: The function 'draw_parallel_lines_cut_by_transversal' creates a visualization of two parallel lines cut by a transversal line. It accepts an input of type 'ParallelLinesTransversal' which includes the angle between the transversal and the parallel lines, and labels for the angles formed at the intersection points. The function ensures a minimum line length of 3 units and adjusts the length of the transversal line based on the provided angle. This visualization can be used in teaching geometry, specifically in understanding the properties of parallel lines and transversal lines, and the angles they form.

details: angle: The angle between the transversal and the parallel lines
top_left_angle_label: Label for the top left angle formed at the intersection
bottom_left_angle_label: Label for the bottom left angle formed at the intersection
top_right_angle_label: Label for the top right angle formed at the intersection
bottom_right_angle_label: Label for the bottom right angle formed at the intersection
The angle must be a positive number less than 180 degrees
All angle labels must be non-empty strings
The length of the transversal line is calculated based on the angle and has a minimum value of 3 units
The function draws two parallel lines of equal length, cut by a transversal line
The angle between the transversal and the parallel lines is determined by the 'angle' input
Labels for the angles formed at the intersection points are displayed based on the input parameters
The length and position of the lines are adjusted to ensure they are centered and fit within the visualization
